announcement: m_c announced that they are expecting kits.
litter_guess: m_c thinks they'll have a small litter.
m_c thinks they'll have a large litter.
m_c is unsure how many kits they'll have.
major_severity: They decide to move into the nursery in preparation for their soon-to-come kits.
minor_severity: They won't be moving into the nursery just yet.
comment: both the minor and major severity strings will appear in conjunction with either a litter guess or an announcement. Write them accordingly!
They should also start with a space in order to ensure there is a space between the announcement/litter sentence and the severity sentence.

unmated_parent: m_c had a {insert}, but refused to talk about their origin.
m_c had a {insert} with an unknown partner.
m_c had a {insert} and refused to talk about their progenitor.
m_c had a {insert} and is absolutely refusing to talk about it or acknowledge it at all.
m_c doesn't feel ready to be a parent of this {insert}. But they promise to the tiny flailing limbs by their side that they'll do their best, they swear on StarClan itself.
No one knows who m_c has had their {insert} with, but they seem very happy watching over their little offspring in the nursery.
Whenever someone asks whether m_c will be alright raising their {insert} alone, they just smile, and reply that everything is going to work out fine.
A {insert}! m_c welcomes them happily, and seems unperturbed by the lack of a partner in the nursery with them.
two_parents: In the nursery, m_c lies suckling a {insert}, r_c watching over them and purring so hard their body vibrates.
m_c and r_c's eyes meet over their {insert}, full of love for their growing family.
In the quiet of the nursery, in the nest they've spent so long preparing, m_c and r_c welcome a {insert}.
With their {insert} mewling at their belly, m_c's long pregnancy has finally given them and r_c the expansion to their family they've been hoping and waiting for.

Even with r_c by their side, m_c doesn't feel ready to be a parent of this {insert}. But they promise to the tiny flailing limbs by their side that they'll do their best, they swear on StarClan itself.
r_c has been waiting eagerly to meet their offspring. At m_c's invitation, they crawl into the nursery, purring and joining m_c in licking their {insert} clean.

r_c has been impatient for the end of m_c's pregnancy, and when they hear m_c has gone into labor they drop what they're doing and sprint for the nursery, where m_c is bringing a {insert} into the world.

m_c is so, so grateful that their adorable {insert} is here - both thrilled to meet them, and thrilled that r_c can take a turn parenting while m_c finally takes a little break from the stuffy air of the nursery.
m_c and r_c were so busy worrying about and looking forward to the birth that it's only now that they look at their {insert}, and wonder what to name them.
Purring with r_c against their back, m_c feels like they're going to explode with love, looking at their tiny new {insert}.
dead_mate: m_c looks at their {insert}, choking on both a purr and a wail. How are they supposed to do this without r_c?
m_c sobs and pushes their new {insert} away from them. They look far too much like r_c for m_c to stand the sight of them.
m_c purrs sadly over the tiny {insert} StarClan has blessed them with. They see r_c in their little pawpads, in their ears and eyes and mews.
Cats call out, but m_c can't be convinced to go back to the nursery. Not with the new {insert} made from them and r_c there, taunting m_c with what should have been.
Looking down at r_c's last gift to them, m_c vows to protect their new {insert}.
It's so hard, so very, very, nearly insurmountably hard doing this without their mate, but m_c wouldn't change it for the world. This {insert} is the last piece of r_c they have.
both_unmated: m_c gave birth to a {insert} with r_c, and is looking forward to co-parenting.
r_c sheepishly peeks into the nursery to see their {insert}. m_c looks surprised, but not unhappy, to see them there, and welcomes them in with a purr.
m_c purrs loudly as r_c grooms their pelt. As their new {insert} squirms around m_c's belly, the two cats think about their new responsibilities together.
m_c gazes lovingly at their new {insert}. r_c looks nervous and awkward in the nursery, but m_c calls them forward to meet the litter.
affair: m_c secretly had a {insert} with r_c.
m_c hopes that their {insert} doesn't look too much like r_c, otherwise questions might follow.
r_c goes to visit m_c in the nursery with their new {insert}, on a completely innocent mission to deliver food to the new parent.
The newly arrived {insert} that m_c has just given birth to looks suspiciously like r_c.
death: Later, as the medicine cat wails with m_c's blood streaked through their pelt, and a warrior comes to move the body for its vigil, no one knows what to do with the {insert}.

As the sun tracks across the sky, m_c's bleeding gets worse and worse. It was still worth it, m_c decides, even as the medicine cat fights an impossible battle to keep them out of StarClan. Still so worth it.
The birth was stressful, and m_c is exhausted and still bleeding and really just wants to sleep. Unfortunately, they don't ever wake up again.
m_c wasn't expecting their birth to be so incredibly painful, and as the day wears on their condition deteriorates, leaving their {insert} mewling and trying to suckle a cooling body.

It breaks their heart that they won't get to be with their {insert} as they grow. m_c pants out instructions and pleads to their friends around them, as the blood loss from birth slowly takes their life.
However, m_c is too far gone for the herbs they're given to choke down to fix this blood loss, and the cats are helpless as m_c slowly slips to StarClan.
Later, hours later, eons later, the {insert} mews. Outside, m_c's body cools, the toll of birth too much for it.
Though all looks fine, the Clan will wake to discover m_c's body cold in the nursery, their {insert} mewing in vain for their parent.

Though birth is always considered a difficult and risky event, no one thought they'd lose m_c to it, not after the {insert} was all born and seemed fine. They thought the blood loss was under control.
difficult_birth: The birth was stressful and m_c lost a lot of blood.
m_c pants, looking at their wonderful {insert} and deciding that the pain and blood loss was all worth it.
Weak with blood loss, m_c nevertheless purrs at the sight of their {insert}.
Though the blood loss did not make the birth any easier for m_c.
Though m_c seems overly exhausted and weak from the birth.
m_c wasn't expecting this birth to be so intensely painful.
Everyone says giving birth is difficult, but m_c feels like this one has been worse than most.
This will all be worth it, m_c groans, promising themselves that as the pains of afterbirth rock their exhausted and bleeding body.
m_c chokes down the herbs given to them, retching at the taste but knowing they need them to stop the blood loss.
